page.title: 05Leicester's Market
page.content: Leicester's Market is{typical of the {Midlands and North Country}and has been held on the same site since the{ {Thirteenth Century.}The original market was only held on Saturdays and was known as the{Saturday Market;} markets on other days were held on different sites; today it is held on every weekday on this site. Originally only food was sold but since the 1900's clothes and other consumer goods could be bought. During the{early 1970's}an{indoor market}was added to the site; at the same time the{Fish Market}moved from Friar Lane to the ground floor of the indoor site. Today it is the{largest retail {market in the land}with{over 400 {stalls}by acquirng trade from smaller county markets eg Hallaton. The{Cattle {Market}on Welford Road has recently declined in importance.
